english.segment1: When all Thy mercies, O my God, My rising soul surveys, Transported with the view I'm lost. In wonder, love, and praise.
english.segment2: Unnumbered comforts to my soul. Thy tender care bestowed. Before my infant heart could know. From whom those comforts flowed
english.segment3: When worn with sickness, oft hast Thou, With health renewed my face, And when in sins and sorrows bowed, Revived my soul with grace.
english.segment4: Through every period of my life. Thy goodness I'll pursue, And after death, in distant worlds, The glorious theme renew.
